result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Eric R. Enli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Morris Taylor in court. State Public Defender's Office has not appointed attorney for defendant. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:20 AM . Prosecuting attorney Kimberly A Hardtke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Morris Taylor in court. Defendant is looking to obtain counsel.  Court advises that defendant should also make an application at the SPD's office if he has not obtained counsel before next court date.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with WalMart, Lynn Watson, Elijah Flowers, Tiffany Goetsch, Caroline Burnett or their residence or place of employment.

Defendant Morris Taylor appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Kevin Martin appears in court for Morris Taylor. Asst. District Attorney Jessica Gereau and Student Intern Claire Lamal appear on behalf of the State.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
